marketNews.title: Compilation of Share Purchases by Controllers and Directors Amidst IHSG Volatility
marketNews.content: A number of company controllers and directors conducted share purchase activities amidst the volatility of the IHSG over the past week. These purchases were mainly made after the IHSG experienced a significant decline, leading the BEI to temporarily implement a trading halt on Tuesday (18/3). Below is a compilation of these purchases:

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: The purchase actions above may indicate confidence from controllers/directors in their respective company fundamentals/value. Although these purchases can foster optimism among some market players and provide support for the IHSG, we assess that an increase in investor confidence - especially foreign investors - is needed for a more significant IHSG recovery.

marketNews.title: US Central Bank Holds Interest Rates
marketNews.content: The US central bank, The Fed, held its benchmark interest rate, the Fed Funds Rate, at the level of 4.25%-4.5% on Wednesday (19/3) local time. Fed Governor Jerome Powell stated that this decision was made amid economic uncertainty and the potential for rising inflation and unemployment rates in line with new government policies, including the imposition of import tariffs. The Fed maintained its projection of 2 rate cuts until the end of 2025, unchanged from the projection announced in December 2024. Nevertheless, the Fed now projects US economic growth to be at 1.7% throughout 2025, down from the previous projection of 2.1%. Meanwhile, inflation during 2025 is projected higher at 2.7%, compared to the previous projection of 2.5%.

marketNews.title: Gold Price Movement Post-FOMC
marketNews.content: The spot gold price rose +0.5% to the level of 3,047.8 US dollars per troy ounce in trading on Wednesday (19/3) night following the Fed's FOMC meeting. The price then briefly increased to the level of 3,057.2 US dollars per troy ounce on Thursday (20/3), marking an all-time high.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo Set to Meet Capital Market Players
marketNews.content: Head of the National Economic Council (DEN), Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan, stated that President Prabowo Subianto will meet with Indonesian capital market players in the near future. This follows the implementation of a 30-minute trading halt near the end of session 1 trading on Tuesday (18/3) due to a daily decline exceeding -5%. Luhut assessed the drop in the IHSG as something common in a country's stock exchange, where other countries also experience similar events at different times.

marketNews.title: Saratoga Group Forms Data Center Joint Venture with Digital Realty
marketNews.content: Bersama Digital Infrastructure Asia (BDIA) formed a joint venture (JV) company with the global data center company, Digital Realty. The JV is named Digital Realty Bersama and is equally owned (50% : 50%). BDIA's subsidiary, Bersama Digital Data Centres, will be merged into the JV. The majority shareholders of BDDC are Provident Capital Partners, Saratoga Investama Sedaya ($SRTG), a consortium led by Macquarie Asset Management, and Distro Hub. Vice President Commissioner of Digital Realty Bersama, Setyanto Hantoro, stated that they currently own two data centers with a capacity of 6.5 MW in CGK 10 and CGK 11, with capacities of 1.5 MW and 5 MW, respectively. Digital Realty Bersama plans to increase capacity in CGK 11 up to 32 MW.

marketNews.title: People's Bank of China Holds Benchmark Lending Rates Steady
marketNews.content: The Chinese central bank, People Bank of China (PBoC), maintained its 1-year and 5-year tenor benchmark lending rates at 3.1% and 3.6%, respectively, in line with expectations. The market anticipates that the pressured yuan will be a major obstacle for Beijing in its efforts to implement monetary easing. Previously, the PBoC stated last week that it would cut interest rates and ease the minimum reserve requirement ratio at an appropriate time.

marketNews.title: Housing Minister Announces Stimulus for Low-Income Housing (MBR)
marketNews.content: Minister of Housing and Settlement Areas, Maruarar Sirait (Ara), mentioned receiving an order from President Prabowo Subianto to accelerate the provision of housing for low-income communities (MBR) through the socialization of a number of policies. One of these incentives includes the abolition of Land and Building Rights Acquisition Fee (BPHTB) from 5% to 0%. In addition, the government also waives the Building Approval Levy (PBG) to simplify building permit processing, and the Value Added Tax (PPN) stimulus will be borne by the state until June 2025. On the same occasion, Ara conveyed that subsidized housing that has been built and distributed has reached more than 130,000 units as of March 2025.

marketNews.title: Five Investors Sign Land Utilization Agreements in OIKN
marketNews.content: Head of OIKN, Basuki Hadimuljono, stated on Wednesday (19/3) that five investors have signed agreements for land utilization under OIKN control and Notarial Deeds. These five investors include PT Citadel Group Indonesia, PT Berkat Kalimantan Abadi, PT Perintis Pondasi Teknotama, PT Perintis Power Investment, and PT Sentra Unggul Nusantara. The total investment value reached 2.42 trillion rupiah.

marketNews.title: Indonesian Parliament Passes Contentious TNI Law Amendments
marketNews.content: The Indonesian House of Representatives (DPR RI) approved the revision of the TNI law which allows more civilian positions to be filled by military officers. This revision received criticism from civil society groups who stated that it could bring Indonesia back to the New Order era. The law requires officers to first resign from the military before occupying a civilian position. Furthermore, officers cannot join state-owned enterprises (BUMNs) to avoid concerns about military officer involvement in business.

tickerNews.title: PT Dua Samudera Perkasa Becomes New Controller of PT Dana Brata Luhur (TEBE) Via Major Share Purchase
tickerNews.content: PT Dua Samudera Perkasa, a shareholder of Dana Brata Luhur, bought approximately 505 million (39.31%) shares of TEBE at a price of 500 rupiah per share from PT Prima Mineral Utama on March 18, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 252 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, PT Dua Samudera Perkasa's ownership in TEBE increased from 31.84% to 71.14%, while PT Prima Mineral Utama's ownership decreased from 39.31% to none. After this transaction, PT Dua Samudera Perkasa becomes the new controller of the company and will therefore conduct a mandatory tender offer.

tickerNews.title: PT Bank OCBC NISP Approves 2024 Dividend Payout of IDR 2.4 Trillion
tickerNews.content: PT Bank OCBC NISP shareholders approved the distribution of the 2024 fiscal year dividend of approximately 2.4 trillion rupiah today, Thursday (20/3), equivalent to a 49.98% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: 40.4%). This amount indicates a dividend of 106 rupiah per share with a dividend yield of 7.97%, based on NISP's closing share price on Thursday (20/3) at 1,330 rupiah per share. The cum date and final dividend payment date have not yet been announced.

tickerNews.title: ACES Reports -6.6% YoY Same Store Sales Growth in February 2025
tickerNews.content: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia recorded same store sales growth (SSSG) of -6.6% YoY in February 2025 (vs. January 2025: +3.4% YoY, February 2024: +15.3% YoY). In February 2025, there was a decrease in SSSG across all regions, with the smallest decline recorded in Outside Java (-4% YoY), followed by Jakarta (-7.8% YoY), and Java outside Jakarta (-8.1% YoY). Management attributed this decline to the high base effect in February 2024 due to the 2024 Presidential Election (pilpres). ACES recorded a total of 247 stores as of the end of February 2025, an increase of 1 store from the total stores at the end of January 2025.

tickerNews.title: BRPT Considers IPO for Subsidiaries and Target for Shell SECP Acquisition in 2025
tickerNews.content: Barito Pacific management stated in the 4Q24 earnings call on Wednesday (19/3) that the company is opening opportunities to take its property subsidiary, PT Griya Idola, and its step-down subsidiary, PT Chandra Daya Investasi, public. However, management emphasized that the company will make the best possible preparations and will only proceed with the IPO when both companies are truly ready. Additionally, management is targeting the acquisition of Shell Energy and Chemicals Park Singapore (SECP) and the operation of the Java 9 & 10 Coal Power Plant - owned by PT Indo Raya Tenaga - to begin reflecting in the company's 2025 financial statements.

tickerNews.title: PWON Allocates IDR 2.71 Trillion Capex in 2025, Focusing on Mall Development
tickerNews.content: Pakuwon Jati allocated a capex of 2.71 trillion rupiah throughout 2025, unchanged from the 2024 capex allocation. The capex will largely be used to fund ongoing superblock projects, such as the expansion of Kota Kasablanka and Gandaria City superblocks. Around 13% of the capex allocation will be used for mall business development. Director of Business Development, Ivy Wong, stated that PWON will focus on mall business development in Semarang and Batam for the next five years.

tickerNews.title: BEST Targets 20 Hectares of Land Sales in 2025 Focused on Data Center Industry
tickerNews.content: Bekasi Fajar Industrial Estate targets the sale of 20 hectares (ha) of land in 2025 with potential revenue of approximately 600 billion rupiah (vs. 2024 target: 600 billion rupiah, 9M24 realization: 404 billion rupiah). Head of Corporate Finance & Investor Relations, Calvin Neonardi, stated that the company is currently focused on land sales for the data center industry due to high demand since last year. The company also allocated a capex of 200 billion rupiah which will be used for warehouse construction and land acquisition.

tickerNews.title: Arsjad Rasjid to Become President Commissioner in EXCL and FREN Merger Entity (XLSmart)
tickerNews.content: Kontan reports that Arsjad Rasjid will become the President Commissioner in XLSmart Telecom Sejahtera Tbk, the resulting entity from the merger between XL Axiata and Smartfren Telecom ($FREN). Based on the invitation received by Kontan on Thursday (20/3), Arsjad will attend the press conference on the merger progress between EXCL and FREN as the prospective President Commissioner of XLSmart and will also be one of the speakers at the event. For information, Arsjad currently serves as the President Director of Indika Energy ($INDY).

tickerNews.title: HATM Plans to Acquire Two Bulk Carriers, Funding Capex via Rights Issue
tickerNews.content: Habco Trans Maritima President Director, Andrew Kam, stated that the company plans to purchase two bulk carrier ships worth 400 billion rupiah this year, increasing HATM's bulk carrier fleet to seven units. This step was taken to capture opportunities in the sea transportation sector for bulk commodities. According to Andrew, this purchase will provide HATM with an additional carrying capacity of 90,000 to 100,000 tons. For information, HATM has budgeted a total capex of 500 billion rupiah this year, where 100 billion rupiah will be allocated for ship maintenance. The capex funds will be fulfilled through a rights issue to be conducted this year, targeting fund acquisition of 537.6 billion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: LABA Plans Rights Issue Up to IDR 900 Billion and Controller Decreases Stake
tickerNews.content: Green Power Group plans to issue additional shares (rights issue) of no more than 6 billion shares with a total share issuance value of no more than 900 billion rupiah. This implies a maximum dilution effect of 84% with an exercise price of around 150 rupiah per share. In this rights issue, the controlling shareholder will include assets covering nickel mines and office buildings, and will raise cash funds. In a separate transaction, the controller of Green Power Group, PT Nev Stored Energy, transferred 55 million (4.99%) LABA shares and sold 165 million (14.95%) LABA shares respectively at an average price of 160 rupiah per share and 140 rupiah per share on February 28, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 8.8 billion rupiah and approximately 23.1 billion rupiah, respectively. The transactions are intended for share guarantees and development of LABA and its subsidiaries. After this transaction, PT Nev Stored Energy's ownership in LABA decreased from 46.13% to 26.19%.
